item.title: Marvel MaXimum Collection Includes X-Men Arcade and More
item.content:encoded:
Fans of Marvel superheroes will be able to play more than a dozen classic games with a newly announced collection from Limited Run Games

Marvel MaXimum Collection was just announced during IGN Fan Fest 2026. It’s a collection of games coming to Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X/S, and Steam. At this time, no release date has been announced, but the game is available to be wishlisted.

What’s included in Nintendo Marvel MaXimum Collection?

The trailer boasts the return of several classic 8-bit and 16-bit games. The description notes that 13 titles will be featured altogether. Some of the games on display included Captain America and the Avengers, Spider-Man/Venom: Maximum Carnage, Venom/Spider-Man: Separation Anxiety, and the classic X-Men arcade game from 1992. Handheld titles will also be included in this collection.

Additional features include Rollback Netcode, allowing six players to play online in X-Men: The Arcade Game. There’s also a Save Anywhere, an in-game rewind option, a museum, and more.

The X-Men arcade game was once briefly playable on Xbox Live Arcade during the Xbox 360 generation. but would be delisted upon license expiration. Insider Gaming will continue to provide updates on the forthcoming collection as more information is made available.

What do you think about this announcement? What games are you hoping get announced for the Marvel MaXimum Collection? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Insider Gaming Showcase Will be Held May 28th To Help Games Get Funded
item.content:encoded:
Insider Gaming is proud to announce its debut virtual showcase.

Airing on May 28th at 3pm ET/12pm PT/8pm UK across Insider Gaming’s YouTube and social media platforms, the Insider Gaming Showcase comes to you with the goal of helping games get funded or find publisher backing.

But why? Well, to put it simply, the gaming industry is going through unprecedented times, and one of the hardest challenges that developers currently face is funding, and it’s only getting more difficult. That’s why we want to use our outlet and its exposure to help games get seen – completely free of charge to developers.

The showcase will feature nonstop, back-to-back game trailers, with no fluff in between to distract viewers from the awesome games currently in development. We’ll also feature a “concept” section in the showcase, featuring amazing concept art and ideas of games that haven’t yet reached a stage of development where footage can be shown.

Following the showcase, we will have separate deep-dive video interviews with the developers, in addition to written coverage on our website and in the app, so viewers can learn more about the games and the developers behind them.

In addition, Insider Gaming will also act as a PR agency to a loose degree. We will be working with other outlets and content creators before, during, and after the showcase to facilitate potential interviews to help get the games seen by as many different audiences as possible, again, free of charge.

To take things one step further, Insider Gaming will also compile all the games from the showcase into a dossier containing the contact information for each featured game, which we will send to our extensive list of investors, VC’s, and publishers after the show.

Insider Gaming has high ambitions for the showcase, aiming to add at least 1 million cumulative new wishlists for the games we feature.

Moving past May 28th, we also want the showcase to be a recurring event, with a second showcase tentatively planned for December, with two shows a year moving forward.

Of course, we’re not ignorant of the fact that putting on a showcase costs time and money, and that’s why, behind the scenes, we’ve already partnered with a few companies to sponsor the show and are actively looking for a few more to help support this great initiative in times when developers need the exposure.

You can contact Tom Henderson at tom(a)insider-gaming.com if you would like to sponsor the show. Developers can now submit their games by emailing Insider Gaming’s Executive Editor Mike Straw at michael(a)insider-gaming.com or filling out our submission form:

Submissions are open until March 20.

Outlets and content creators can contact either email address above to get involved as partners or for potential co-streaming opportunities.@

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 The Two Masters DLC Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Ninja Gaiden 4: The Two Masters DLC will release next week, in March 2026.

Team Ninja’s latest mainline entry to the Ninja Gaiden franchise was released back in October 2025 and has been faring quite well since release. Now, the developers have finally provided an update on how they plan to expand the experience with a brand-new DLC for the game.

Ninja Gaiden 4 DLC Will Add New Story Missions, Weapons, and More

A new post by Team Ninja on X (formerly Twitter) confirms the release date of the new The Two Masters DLC for Ninja Gaiden 4, and it arrives on March 4, 2026. The new DLC will add three new chapters, weapons, enemies, and the Abyssal Road challenge mode. Learn more about the new additions below.

The story expansion for Ninja Gaiden 4 will see Yakumo and Ryu’s battle against fiends continue, as the two characters battle against even deadlier enemies, challenging bosses, and new trials. The new weapons will also help expand Yakumo and Ryu’s combat styles. Yakumo will receive the “Solitaire” scythe, which is great for crowd control, and Ryu’s will get “Jakotsumon” serpent gauntlets, which are useful for fast, close-quarters combat.

Abyssal Road in the Ninja Gaiden 4: The Two Masters DLC is an endurance-style mode where players face 100 unique combat encounters. These encounters include enemies from both the base game and the DLC, and introduce the new Special Blood Essence and Frenzied enemy mechanics, which dynamically alter battle conditions.

The DLC will also arrive with “a wide range of quality-of-life improvements, balance adjustments, and bug fixes, including combat responsiveness improvements, new weapon set customization options, and fixes across multiple chapters to ensure a smoother experience throughout the campaign.” Players with Deluxe Edition or Deluxe upgrade will get the DLC for free, and others can buy it for $14.99 on March 4.

In other news, Team Ninja’s first leader, and the director of Dead or Alive and Ninja Gaiden 2004, passed away in October 2025. Will you be purchasing the Ninja Gaiden 4: The Two Masters DLC? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Assassin’s Creed Hexe’s director departing from Ubisoft. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
